title: Man accused of shooting cousin appears in court
content:
ATLANTA (CBS46) -
Dontavis Montgomery, the man accused of fatally shooting his cousin, appeared in court today for another crime.
Montgomery was put back in jail last month after allegedly shooting and killing his cousin, Marquez Montgomery. He was out on bond for the stabbing death of Nicholas Roberts in 2015. Today he appeared in court for his first crime.
A judge revoked the 21-year-old's bond for several reasons. Montgomery was not supposed to be at his grandmother's house that night with Marquez. He was supposed to be living at his uncle's house and on curfew. He was also not allowed to have any weapons on him while out on bond.
Teen allegedly killed by cousin laid to rest
The teenager who was allegedly shot and killed by his cousin at a home in northwest Atlanta will be laid to rest on Monday.
Police responded to the 3800 block of Adkins Road NW around 7 p.m. on November 28 and found that Marquez Montgomery was shot in the head. Police initially said Montgomery was not alert, conscious or breathing and later verified that the teen was pronounced dead on arrival.
On Tuesday, police say the victim's cousin, Dontavis Montgomery, was arrested and charged with felony murder. He is accused of shooting the victim without provocation, according to authorities.
Police say Dontavis Montgomery was also on bond after being arrested and charged with murder and aggravated assault in connection to a previous homicide in January 2015.
The victim attended Benjamin E. Mays High School in Atlanta.
The funeral for Marquez Montgomery will be held at 12 p.m. Monday at Greater Mount Carmel Baptist Church on Campbellton Road.
